thread.title: Justin Brownlee supports Ginebra in do-or-die game vs Alaska
thread.title_full: Justin Brownlee supports Ginebra in do-or-die game vs Alaska

author: Jane Bracher
title: Justin Brownlee supports Ginebra in do-or-die game vs Alaska
text:
Justin Brownlee supports Ginebra in do-or-die game vs Alaska Brownlee is courtside to support his former teammates as they try to extend their Philippine Cup Published 8:35 PM, February 07, 2017 Updated 8:35 PM, February 07, 2017 SUPPORTIVE. Justin Brownlee watches Ginebra take on Alaska. Photo by Czeasar Dancel/Rappler MANILA, Philippines – Justin Brownlee, the hero of Barangay Ginebra's 2016 PBA Governors' Cup championship, came to watch his old team try and extend their Philippine Cup in a do-or-die game against the Alaska Aces on Tuesday, February 7, at the Smart-Araneta Coliseum. 
Brownlee, the import whose name is now permanently etched in Ginebra lore for his title-winning 3-pointer in October 2016, was courtside to support his former teammates. He is set to lead PH-Mighty Sports in a Dubai tilt on February 18. 
( WATCH: Justin Brownlee hits 3-pointer to clinch championship for Ginebra ) COURTSIDE. Justin Brownlee reconnects with his former Ginebra teammates. Photo by Czeasar Dancel/Rappler 
Speaking during a broadcast interview, Brownlee was hopeful Ginebra would lock down in the second half after trailing for most of the first. "Hopefully we can come out strong in the second half and get this win," he said. "There's no way I could miss this game," Brownlee added. 
Ginebra, which forced the knockout game for the last semifinals berth, trailed by two at the half against the twice-to-beat Alaska. – Rappler.com HOW DOES THIS STORY MAKE YOU FEEL? Happy
